trans-unit.source:
\n

Represents a stack trace, which is an ordered collection of one or more stack frames.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxxxx x xxxxx xxxxx$ xxxxx xx xx xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The exception object from which to construct the stack trace.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

\ntrue to capture the file name, line number, and column number; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxx xxx xxxx xxxx$ xxxx xxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Returns a copy of all stack frames in the current stack trace.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Builds a readable representation of the stack trace.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxx x xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A readable representation of the stack trace.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxxxx.$$x$$x
